The Noob Approach - Ruby on Rails

So you have decided to get started with Ruby on Rails? Much easier said than done. I remember when I thought that and would only think it would take a week or so, but I found it very difficult and time consuming as it felt like I had a major lack of direction when trying to break into the world of Ruby on Rails. I hope this post can shed a little light from my past experiences and get you on the right track.

Getting Started with Installation

For Winodws users please check out railsinstaller.org For Mac users I highly suggest you read the railscasts guide

One of the most daunting tasks for getting started with Rails may be the fact that installing it can be quite a bitch. So, for you linux users I have supplied a quick bash script to simplify the task.

What installs?
  • RVM [Ruby Version Manager]
  • Ruby 1.9.3
  • Rails 3
  • nodejs
  • A smack load of libraries
  • cURL
Additionally the script will attempt to load the rvm environment on login. If you wish to use more modern versions of software you must edit the script yourself. You must run the script from a login shell inorder to install correctly. The script will only function on Linux with bash. The script is available here : download git repo If you have any questions feel free to comment or contact through github.
